Students API - WORK IN PROGRESS#

This page highlights the different endpoints that are available to the web interface to interact with student data and before-care/after-care services data.

Usage#

GET /api/v1/students#

An endpoint that retrieves all the students from the database and formats it into a list.

Status Codes

  • 200 OK – When the list of students is successfully retrieved from the database.

Example request:

GET /api/v1/students HTTP/1.1

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": 200,
  "message": "success",
  "data": {
      "students": [
          {
              "student_id": "jjerome4",
              "first_name": "Jason",
              "last_name": "Jerome",
              "is_enabled": true,
              "entry_created": "2022-03-01T20:40:03"
          }
      ]
  }
}
GET /api/v1/students/count#

An endpoint that counts the number of students registered in the database and returns it in the response.

Status Codes

  • 200 OK – When the total number of students is successfully retrieved from the database.

Example request:

GET /api/v1/students/count HTTP/1.1

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": 200,
  "message": "success",
  "data": {
      "count": 2
  }
}
POST /api/v1/students/new#

An endpoint that creates a new student in the database given a valid first and last name.

Parameters

  • first_name – The first name of the new student.

  • last_name – The last name of the new student.

Status Codes

  • 201 Created – When the new student is successfully added to the database.

  • 400 Bad Request – When the first or last name of the new student is invalid, or the student already exists in the database

Example request:

POST /api/v1/students HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "first_name": "Jason",
  "last_name": "Jerome"
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 201 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": 201,
  "message": "success",
  "data": {
      "student": {
          "student_id": "jjerome5",
          "first_name": "Jason",
          "last_name": "Jerome",
          "is_enabled": true,
          "entry_created": "2022-03-01T20:46:14"
      }
  }
}
POST /api/v1/students/checkin#

An endpoint that creates a new student in the database given a valid first and last name. KNOWN ERRORS: Currently a successful student check in returns a status 500 error even though the student was successfully checked in.

Parameters

  • student_id – The student ID of the student.

  • check_in_date – The date that the student is checked in to the care service.

  • care_type – The type of care the student is registered to indicated by ‘false’ for before-care, and ‘true’ for after-care.

Status Codes

  • 200 OK – When the student is successfully checked in to the chosen service.

  • 400 Bad Request – When the request body contains invalid parameters, or the student is already checked in to the chosen service for the day.

Example request:

POST /api/v1/students HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "student_id": "jjerome4",
  "check_in_date": "2022-02-20",
  "care_type": false
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": 200,
  "message": "success",
  "data": {
      "student": {
          "student_id": "jjerome5",
          "first_name": "Jason",
          "last_name": "Jerome",
          "check_in_date": "2022-02-20",
          "check_in_time": "20:46:14",
          "check_out_time": null,
          "care_type": false,
          "entry_created": "2022-02-20T20:46:14"
      }
  }
}

Implementation Documentation#

This module consists of FastAPI routing for Students. This handles all the REST API logic for creating, destroying, and updating student-related data.

class server.web_api.routing.v1.students.routing.StudentsRouter#

Bases: object

The API router responsible for defining endpoints relating to students. The defined endpoints allow HTTP requests to conduct childcare-related operations with the student entity.

check_in_student(*, pyd_student_checkin: server.lib.data_classes.student.PydanticStudentCareHoursCheckIn)#

An endpoint that checks-in a student into the before-care or after-care service and records the time of check-in. Any student checked into before-care is automatically checked out at the end of the before-care service. Any student checked into after-care can be checked out at any time after checking in. Failure to check out a student from after-care will result in the automatic check-out of the student at the end of after-care.

Parameters

pyd_student_checkin (PydanticStudentCareHoursCheckIn) – The Pydantic StudentCareHoursCheckIn reference. This means that HTTP requests to this endpoint must include the required fields in the Pydantic StudentCareHoursCheckIn class.

Returns

A response model containing information regarding the student and the check-in time and date that has been registered in the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the data provided in the request body is invalid, or the student is already checked in to the care service for the provided date.

check_out_student(*, student_checkout: server.lib.data_classes.student.PydanticStudentCareHoursCheckOut)#

Not Implemented!

Parameters

student_checkout (Not Implemented!) – Not Implemented!

Returns

Not Implemented!

Return type

Not Implemented!

create_new_student(*, pyd_student: server.lib.data_classes.student.PydanticStudent)#

An endpoint that creates a new student record and adds it to the students’ table in the database.

Parameters

pyd_student (PydanticStudent) – The Pydantic Student reference. This means that HTTP requests to this endpoint must include the required fields in the Pydantic Student class.

Returns

A response model containing the student object that was created and inserted into the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

Raises

HTTPException – If the request body contains a student first name or last name that is invalid, or the data provided is formatted incorrectly.

get_all_students()#

An endpoint that retrieves all the students from the database.

Returns

List of all the students in the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel

get_students_count()#

An endpoint that counts the number of students that are registered in the database.

Returns

A response model containing the number of students in the database. The count will be 0 if there are no students registered in the database.

Return type

server.web_api.models.ResponseModel
